page.title: 01Duartmore Forest
page.content: The area is a rocky, boggy, treeless coastal area with a loch and coniferous plantation partly within it The plantation has not grown well and is a commercial failure. The forester's house is now the house of the salmon hatchery manager. It is the only house in the area. There are a few sheep on the heather and bog covered hillsides. The salmon hatchery employs 3 full time and 3 part time workers. The pure water from the loch is vital to the hatchery. It is hard to find a good level site such as this. The firm Joseph Johnston & Sons Ltd of Montrose are very strict about visitors to prevent infection getting in to the hatchery. Some of the fish go to sea cages after 18 months, some are sold to other fish farms.
